content: Hey! I noticed that "Narrow to topic" has a megaphone icon, and it's not intuitive to me why that would be. Does it make sense to other people? If not, any ideas for better options? I was thinking maybe something in the direction of https://thenounproject.com/term/narrow/716809/, though I don't see an equivalent in Font Awesome.
It seems strange to be in the menu given the idea is to just click on the topic itself, but perhaps I'm missing something.
(is the 'search' at the topic supposed to be unusable?)
Heh, good point -- do we even need it in the menu in the first place? :)

Yeah, I think we should just remove it from the menu. The only arguable utility it has is introducing the term "narrow", I think, which I'm not sure is important to introduce.

I don't recall the history, but can imagine we included it to ensure the menu was not only 1 item at some point.

Created an issue to remove "Narrow to topic" from the drop-down: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/18027. I tagged it as a good first issue -- I don't know if folks want to add any technical advice?
I don't think that one needs any, and in fact it already has a complete PR :smile:
@Tim Abbott PR #18028 is ready for review (Also I have edited the commit message)
